channel.title: Blog on Lance Briggs – Final Site
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on Lance Briggs – Final Site

item.title: Almost Done
item.description: At this point I’m just wrapping up the last few pieces of the project. Most of the big work is finished, so now it’s just polishing things and making sure everything builds correctly. It’s nice seeing the final site come together.

item.title: Figuring Out Hugo
item.description:
Learning Hugo was confusing at first, especially understanding the difference between _index.md and regular markdown files. After breaking the site a few times, I finally got the structure down.

This post is a reflection on what helped me understand the framework better.

item.title: Little Progress Note
item.description: I spent today cleaning up small things on the site—fixing spacing, checking links, and making sure the menu actually matched the pages. Nothing major, but it helped the site look a lot more put together.

item.title: Quick Update
item.description: Just a quick update while working on the project. Most of my time went into organizing the folders and making sure Hugo was pulling everything from the right section. It wasn’t complicated, but it definitely made me pay attention to the structure.

item.title: What I Learned in This Class
item.description:
This class taught me how to use Git and GitHub correctly, how static sites work, and how to debug mistakes without panicking.

This post sums up the main things I’m taking away from the course.
